level.heading: Role of court in administration of trust.

level.text: The court may intervene in the administration of a trust to the extent its jurisdiction is invoked by an interested person or as provided by law.
A trust is not subject to continuing judicial supervision unless ordered by the court.
A judicial proceeding involving a trust may relate to any matter involving the trust's administration, including a request for instructions and an action to declare rights.

level.heading: Editor’s Notes
level.text: Uniform Law: This section is based upon § 201 of the Uniform Trust Code.
